timeline.bodyText:
Instead of a constructor like this, it might be better to introduce a builder-like mechanism to build the rule. e.g. instead of
new LifecycleRule(
  Status.ENABLED,
  null,
  new Expiration((ZonedDateTime) null, 365, null),
  new RuleFilter("logs/"),
  "rule2",
  null,
  null,
  null));

Something like this:
LifecycleRule.builder().
  id("rule2").
  status(Status.ENABLED).
  ruleFilter("logs/").
  expiration(new Expiration((ZonedDateTime) null, 365, null)).
  build()
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

+package io.minio.messages;
+
+import java.util.Objects;
+import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
+import javax.annotation.Nullable;
+import org.simpleframework.xml.Element;
+import org.simpleframework.xml.Root;
+
+/** Helper class to denote Rule information for {@link LifecycleConfiguration}. */
+@Root(name = "Rule")
+public class LifecycleRule {
+  @Element(name = "AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload", required = false)
+  private AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload abortIncompleteMultipartUpload;
+
+  @Element(name = "Expiration", required = false)
+  private Expiration expiration;
+
+  @Element(name = "Filter", required = false)
+  private RuleFilter filter;
+
+  @Element(name = "ID", required = false)
+  private String id;
+
+  @Element(name = "NoncurrentVersionExpiration", required = false)
+  private NoncurrentVersionExpiration noncurrentVersionExpiration;
+
+  @Element(name = "NoncurrentVersionTransition", required = false)
+  private NoncurrentVersionTransition noncurrentVersionTransition;
+
+  @Element(name = "Status")
+  private Status status;
+
+  @Element(name = "Transition", required = false)
+  private Transition transition;
+
+  /** Constructs new server-side encryption configuration rule. */
+  public LifecycleRule(

replies.bodyText:
Builder is surely helpful for users. However this constructor still serves to prevent invalid values in XML response from server (We see many weirdly implemented S3 servers these days).
The builder is an improvement for many such messages. I think it can be added on user requests.
replies.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should call getBucketLifecycle also and verify that what was set is same as config passed in setBucketLifecycle
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.message: Add object representation of LifecycleConfiguration with API rename.

timeline.bodyText: It might be better to introduce an equals method on the LifecycleConfiguration class and use that to confirm that the config that is received on getting the lifecycle is equal to the config that was passed when setting it.
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

replies.bodyText: As we would need to make a next major release, we can add this in a separate PR after the release.
replies.author: balamurugana
